info.title: Gateway APIs
info.description: Gateway APIs for payments and wallet management

error.description: The details of an error that has occurred

httpStatusCode.description: The http status code (4xx and 5xx HTTP status codes)

errorDetail.example: Oops! An error has occurred: ScriptExecutionFailed

example.errorDetail: Oops! An error has occurred: ScriptExecutionFailed

recordCount.description: The number of records returned in the result set

totalRecords.description: The number of records in total in the full query set

metaChallenge.description: Meta Object containing responses to a step up challenges

items.description: The response to a step up challenge (e.g. credit card step up or gift card passcode)

instrumentId.description: The instrument id related to the step up challenge

type.description: The type of token that has been provided

token.description: The value requested by the challenge

reference.description: An optional reference that could be used for audit tracing

cipherText.description: An encrypted JSON object containing sensitive data

stateOrTerritory.description: The customer's abbreviated state or territory.

countryCode.description: The customer's Alpha-2 (2-character) ISO-3166-1 country code.

apiKeyParam.name: x-api-key
apiKeyParam.description: You are required to use this header, to provide the API key, if this endpoint is being called directly from a web browser based site/page using client side code (eg. via javascript using AJAX).

authKeyParam.name: a-auth-key
authKeyParam.description: You are required to use this header, to provide the base64 encoded API key, if this endpoint is being called from an app (eg. mobile apps) in which case the client secret key can be stored securely on the device, or the calls are made from a server (eg. web server) in which case the client secret key can be stores securely on the server.

authDigestParam.name: x-auth-digest
authDigestParam.description: You are required to use this header, to provide the encrypted API key, if this endpoint is being called from an app (eg. mobile apps) in which case the client secret key can be stored securely on the device, or the calls are made from a server (eg. web server) in which case the client secret key can be stores securely on the server. The API key is encrypted with the client secret key.

messageIdParam.name: x-message-id
messageIdParam.description: This id is used to keep track of the request and its response in the Digital Pay platform. If no value is provided for the request header, Apigee will auto generate an id to use for the request. This header will also be returned in the response and will have the value passed in OR generated for the request.

authorizationParam.name: authorization
authorizationParam.description: The access token is obtained from the auth/login endpoint after a user is authenticated. This token is a bearer token.

versionParam.name: x-v
versionParam.description: The version of the end point requested for this invocation.

walletIdParam.name: x-wallet-id
walletIdParam.description: This header contains the customer wallet Id

merchantIdParam.name: x-merchant-id
merchantIdParam.description: This header contains the merchant identifier

verifyPaymentInstrumentsRequest.description: The JSON request structure of the Verify Payment Instruments endpoint.

clientReference.description: A merchant application specific reference number. This number should uniquely identify the transaction in the merchant’s system.

stepUpToken.description: The step-up token is used to track additional credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) attached to the payment instrument. It's only valid for a predefined time and if an expired step-up token is used during payment, the payment for that instrument will fail and the user will have to get a new step-up token before retrying the payment. A step-up token is returned in the response of a credit card iframe. This property is currently only required for credit card instruments and only if specific credit card information (eg. CVV and expiry) is required during payment.

responseFormat.description: The fraud check response message format.

fraudPayload.description: Set to null to skip the fraud check.

shopifyRequest.description: The JSON request structure of the Verify Payment Instruments endpoint.

x_account_id.description: This is an account identifier assigned to the merchant by the payment processor.

x_reference.description: Unique reference of an order assigned by the merchant

x_signature.description: Request signature to enable verifying requests using the signing mechanism

x_url_callback.description: URL to which a callback notification should be sent asynchronously

x_url_cancel.description: URL to which customer must be redirected when they wish to quit payment flow and return to the merchant's site

x_url_complete.description: URL to which customer must be redirected upon successfully completing payment flow

x_transaction_type.description: You'll only get this value if you're using order management. The valid values are capture, refund, void

x_shopify_order_id.description: The unique identifier of the order the request originated from. This will only be present in order management requests.

getGatewaySessionResponse.description: The JSON response structure of the Customer get Gateway Session endpoint.

merchantReference.description: Merchant reference for a payment or Wallet identifier for wallet management session

sessionId.description: Unique identifier for the Gateway session

apiKey.description: API key used for the merchant

merchantRequiresCvv.description: Value of the the CVV required override header

isGuest.description: True if this customer is completing checkout as a guest

clientReference.description: A client reference associated with the transaction.

paymentRequestId.description: The ID of the associated payment request

merchantId.description: The ID of the merchant associated with this transaction

clientReference.description: An optional client reference associated with the transaction.

executionTime.description: Timestamp of when the transaction occurred

status.description: The current status of the transactions

rollback.description: The rollback state of this transaction

subTransactions.description: Array of transaction responses returned by downstream processes

refundReason.description: The reason provided for the refund. Only provided for REFUND transactions

instruments.description: The instruments used to make the payment. For refunds and cash back amounts will be negative

paymentInstrumentId.description: The ID of the Payment Instrument

instrumentType.description: The type of the payment instrument

transactions.description: The list of transactions associated with the instrument.

executionTime.description: Timestamp of when the transaction occurred

status.description: The current status of the transactions

amount.description: The amount charged against or refunded to this instrument

cartInfo.description: Information from the merchant about the cart for this purchase

paymentAgreements.description: List of any new payment agreements created as part of this payment

amount.description: Amount to be charged as part of this payment agreement

description.description: The description of the payment agreement

startDate.description: Start date for the payment agreement

endDate.description: End date for the payment agreement

frequency.description: Frequency with which the payment agreement will be charged

immediateCharge.description: Whether or not the payment agreement should be immediately charged

paymentAgreementRef.description: Merchant reference for the payment agreement

basket.description: List of items in the customer's shopping basket

shopifyRedirectResponse.description: Shopify redirect response that allows the user to be redirected once an action is complete

redirectURL.description: URL the user will be redirected to

shopifyResponse.description: Shopify redirect response that allows the user to be redirected once an action is complete

x_gateway_reference.description: Unique reference for each response issued by the payment processor.

x_result.description: Valid values are completed, failed, or pending

x_signature.description: Response signature to enable verifying responses using the signing mechanism

x_timestamp.description: Time of transaction completion. UTC Time: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ

x_message.description: A custom error message displayed to the customer.

x_transaction_type.description: If you're using order management, then the valid values are authorization, capture, void, and refund. If you aren't using order management, then this field will use the default value sale

get.description: Retrieve the Gateway session object for the customer

parameters.name: gatewaySessionId
parameters.description: The ID of the specific Gateway Session

post.description: Complete a customer payment against a given Gateway session

parameters.name: gatewaySessionId
parameters.description: The ID of the specific Gateway Session

requestBody.description: Request payload containing payment or payments to be made against the provided cart

paymentRequestId.description: ID of the Payment Request that will be charged

primaryInstrument.description: ID of the primary payment instrument

items.description: ID of any secondary payment instruments used as part of the transaction

clientReference.description: Client reference that will be used when logging the transaction

post.description: Cancel a customer payment against a given Gateway session

parameters.name: gatewaySessionId
parameters.description: The ID of the specific Gateway Session

post.description: Complete a customer wallet management session

parameters.name: gatewaySessionId
parameters.description: The ID of the specific Gateway Session

get.description: Retrieve the Gateway session object for the merchant

parameters.name: gatewaySessionId
parameters.description: The ID of the specific Gateway Session

post.description: Initiate a refund of a successfully processed transaction
Initiate a payment to be completed by a customer
Initiate a wallet management session for the customer
